country.name: United Kingdom
country.description: The United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, commonly known as the United Kingdom or Britain, is a sovereign country in…

popular_destinations.name: London
popular_destinations.description: London is the capital and most populous city of England and the United Kingdom.

popular_destinations.name: Edinburgh
popular_destinations.description: Edinburgh is the capital city of Scotland and one of its 32 council areas.

popular_destinations.name: Glasgow
popular_destinations.description: Glasgow is the largest city in Scotland, and third most populous in the United Kingdom.

popular_destinations.name: Inverness
popular_destinations.description: Inverness is a city in the Scottish Highlands. It is the administrative centre for the Highland council area, and is regarded as the capital…

popular_destinations.name: Belfast
popular_destinations.description: Belfast is the capital city of Northern Ireland, located on the banks of the River Lagan on the east coast of Ireland.

popular_destinations.name: Manchester
popular_destinations.description: Manchester () is a city and metropolitan borough in Greater Manchester, England, with a population of 530,300 as of 2015.

popular_destinations.name: Oxford
popular_destinations.description: Oxford is a city in the South East region of England and the county town of Oxfordshire.

popular_destinations.name: Cardiff
popular_destinations.description: Cardiff is the capital of, and largest city in, Wales, and the eleventh-largest city in the United Kingdom.

popular_destinations.name: Cambridge
popular_destinations.description: Cambridge is a university city and the county town of Cambridgeshire, England, on the River Cam approximately 50 miles north of London.

popular_destinations.name: Liverpool
popular_destinations.description: Liverpool () is a city in North West England, with an estimated population of 491,500 in 2017.

popular_destinations.name: York
popular_destinations.description: York is a historic walled city at the confluence of the rivers Ouse and Foss in North Yorkshire, England.

popular_destinations.name: Bristol
popular_destinations.description: Bristol is a city and county in South West England with a population of 459,300.

popular_destinations.name: Bath, Somerset
popular_destinations.description: Bath is the largest city in the ceremonial county of Somerset, England, known for its Roman-built baths. In 2011, the population was 88,859.

popular_destinations.name: Stirling
popular_destinations.description: Stirling is a city in central Scotland. The market town, surrounded by rich farmland, grew up connecting the royal citadel, the medieval old…

popular_destinations.name: Portsmouth
popular_destinations.description: Portsmouth is a port city in Hampshire, England, mainly on Portsea Island, 70 miles south-west of London and 19 miles south-east of…

popular_destinations.name: Salisbury
popular_destinations.description: Salisbury is a cathedral city in Wiltshire, England, with a population of 40,302, at the confluence of the rivers Nadder, Ebble, Wylye and…

points_of_interest.name: Big Ben
points_of_interest.description: The most famous bell in Europe, perhaps even in the world, Big Ben, is one of the iconic landmarks of London.

points_of_interest.name: Buckingham Palace
points_of_interest.description: This majestic palace is the official residence of British monarchs and is usually recognized as a symbol of UK's monarchy.

points_of_interest.name: Tower Bridge
points_of_interest.description: This fascinating bridge is not only one of London's icons, but also one of the best-known bridges in the world.

points_of_interest.name: Trafalgar Square
points_of_interest.description: Designed by John Nash in 1830, Trafalgar Square is the largest square in London.

points_of_interest.name: Westminster Abbey
points_of_interest.description: First inhabited by Benedictine monks back in the 10th century, this Gothic church is one of the most important icons of London.

points_of_interest.name: Coca‑Cola London Eye
points_of_interest.description: Come for a ride on Europe's largest Ferris wheel. The views from the top are simply fabulous, especially at night.

points_of_interest.name: Tower of London
points_of_interest.description: Also known as Her Majesty's Royal Palace and Fortress, this complex was one of the many castles built as part of the Norman Conquest of…

points_of_interest.name: Piccadilly Circus
points_of_interest.description: A famous road junction and public space in London's West End was built in 1819.

points_of_interest.name: Palace of Westminster
points_of_interest.description: The elaborate Palace of Westminster is home to both houses of the Parliament of the UK -  the House of Commons and the House of Lords.

points_of_interest.name: Saint Paul's Cathedral
points_of_interest.description: This enormous white cathedral and one of London's tallest buildings serves as the seat of the Bishop of London and as a funeral site of…

popular_tours.name: Belfast: Political Conflict 3-Hour Walking Tour
popular_tours.description: Learn about Belfast's troubled history on a 3-hour walking tour with both Republican and Loyalist ex-political prisoners. Explore their neighborhoods and hear their personal stories and the stories of their communities on both sides of the physical wall.

popular_tours.name: Game of Thrones: Guided Bus Day Tour & Giants Causeway
popular_tours.description: Enjoy a full-day guided bus tour from Belfast and explore all the exciting locations featured in the thrilling HBO series, Game of Thrones. Walk along the famous Dark Hedge road, and visit the stunning UNESCO-listed Giant’s Causeway before the day's end.

popular_tours.name: Belfast Taxi Mural Tour
popular_tours.description: Hop in a world famous Belfast Taxi for a personal and upclose look at the conflicts of Belfast, and the rich history that is underneath! Learn from your driver about this city in a fun and informative ride through its streets.

popular_tours.name: Belfast: Giant's Causeway & Carrick-a-Rede Rope Bridge Tour
popular_tours.description: Marvel at the Giant's Causeway, an UNESCO World Heritage site; brave a walk across the Carrick-a-rede Rope Bridge; see memorable film locations such as the Dark Hedges and the Cushendun fishing village; and enjoy spectacular views along the Antrim Coast.

popular_tours.name: Belfast: 2-Hour 15 Minutes A History of Terror Walking Tour
popular_tours.description: Led by expert guides and conflict historians, ‘A History of Terror’ is a multi-award winning city center walking tour of Belfast. In over 1.5 miles and over 2 hours, it will explain the history of ‘The Troubles’ and the path to peace and reconciliation.

popular_tours.name: Belfast: Causeway and Antrim Coast Private Tour
popular_tours.description: Go on a private adventure along the scenic Causeway Coastal Route, one of the world’s most spectacular drives, and visit the fantastic Giant’s causeway, Bushmill’s distillery, Ballycastle, Carrick-a-rede Ropebridge, and other jewels of the Irish coast.

popular_tours.name: Belfast: HMS Caroline Self Guided Tour
popular_tours.description: Step on board and enjoy HMS Caroline, a unique survivor from the First World War and Belfast's newest visitor attraction. Take your time and explore this light cruiser, the only ship remaining from the Grand and High Seas Fleet.

popular_tours.name: Giant's Causeway Visitor Centre Entrance Ticket
popular_tours.description: Explore, enjoy and help preserve the Giant's Causeway. See the science and stories come to life at the interactive spaces at the Visitor's Centre.

popular_tours.name: Giant's Causeway Tour and 2-Day Open Top City Tour Pass
popular_tours.description: Great value combination ticket which includes our Giant's Causeway day tour and an open top city tour of Belfast.

popular_tours.name: Derry: Bloody Sunday & Bogside Murals Walking Tour
popular_tours.description: Immerse yourself in history on this walking tour in Derry's Bogside, the crucible of the conflict in Northern Ireland and home of the world-famous Bogside wall murals.

popular_tours.name: Belfast: 6–Hour Giant's Causeway & City Tour Shore Excursion
popular_tours.description: With this express day trip, have time to prepare for the day ahead without missing the stunning scenery along the North Coast, and delve into the history of Belfast.

popular_tours.name: Belfast Like a Local: Customized Private Tour
popular_tours.description: Familiarize yourself with Belfast through the eyes of a passionate local. You can customize the tour or leave it up to the local for an insightful introduction to the city. Make travel about the people you meet, not just the places you see.

popular_tours.name: From Belfast: Giant's Causeway Full-Day Tour
popular_tours.description: Visit the UNESCO World Heritage Site of the Giant's Causeway on a full-day tour from Belfast. Cross the Carrick-a-Rede Rope Bridge and journey through the romantic Dark Hedges avenue of beech trees along the way.

popular_tours.name: Bloody Sunday and Bogside Murals Private Guided Walking Tour
popular_tours.description: Find out about the history of this important area on a private guided walking tour. Learn about the Bloody Sunday massacre and see the Bogside murals.

popular_tours.name: From Belfast: Game of Thrones Locations Tour Noon Departure
popular_tours.description: This tour departs Belfast later than other operators but takes in all the same sites including Giant’s Causeway and the eerie Dark Hedges. Giving you valuable extra time in the morning, this tour departs at 12:00 PM and returns at approximately 10:30 PM.

popular_tours.name: Belfast: Game Of Thrones Tour & Hop-On Hop-Off Ticket
popular_tours.description: See the beautiful and haunting filming locations of Game of Thrones on this full day tour! Try on costumes and props in the Dark Hedges, and complete your Ireland tour with a 72-hour hop-on hop-off bus ticket to see over 30 other sights!

popular_tours.name: Hillsborough Castle Gardens Entrance Ticket
popular_tours.description: Wander through 100 acres of Hillsborough Castle's beautiful gardens, developed from the 1780's onwards, offering a contrast of ornamental grounds, peaceful woodland, meandering waterways and trimmed lawns.

popular_tours.name: Belfast: The Titanic Experience with SS Nomadic Visit
popular_tours.description: Learn the story of the legendary ocean liner and her fateful journey across the Atlantic at the Belfast Titanic Experience, the world’s largest exhibit dedicated to the Titanic. Journey through 9 galleries at the site of the ship’s construction.

popular_tours.name: Giant’s Causeway Full-Day Tour from Belfast
popular_tours.description: Discover the magnificent Giant’s Causeway on this full-day tour from Belfast. The fully-guided tour will take you to see the famous sights and the stunning scenery along the Antrim coast before reaching the world-renowned Giant’s Causeway.

popular_tours.name: Giant's Causeway and More: Full-Day Luxury Coach Tour
popular_tours.description: Experience a jam-packed day filled with Northern Ireland's top attractions, including the Giant's Causeway, Carrick-a-Rede Rope Bridge, Old Bushmills Distillery, and Carrickfergus and Dunluce castles. Visit Ireland’s only World Heritage Site!
